accordion_items.description: Add accordion items to this accordion container. Use them to answer queries and address potential objects/concerns your clients may have.

accordion_item_title.description:
Input the text you want to be the "title" of your accordion item. This is usually a question that you plan to answer with your accordion_item_content.

The purpose of most accordions is to diffuse 'doubts' in your client's mind. So think of objections or issues they may have and how your service already takes these into account.

accordion_item_content.description: This represents the 'content' or 'answer' of your accordion item. This is where you dispel the doubt or answer a common question your clients might have.

storyblok_name.description: Internally used name, you can ignore or fill it in. It just helps us identify what this component is for.

content.description: Here you can add icons or/and text to your button.

url.description:
This is where clicking the logo takes you. 
1. Select "URL".
2. Just type "/" without the quotation marks if you want to go to the homepage.

Else just type "/about" or "/services" etc.

label.description:
Explain what happens when this button is clicked.

"This takes you to the about page."

"This takes you to Stripe, an external payment processor where you can purchase my service."

target.description:
This decides whether the clicked button opens a new tab or keeps the user in the same tab.

_blank = new tab is opened with the url of this button
_self = current tab's content is replaced

button_size.description: This option determines how large the button is.

button_theme.description: This determines the styling of the button (colors).

button_width.description: This controls whether the button expands into all available space in the container it is in, or whether it simply becomes the size of the text/icons/paddings that it contains.

components.name: container
components.description: Container is essentially a powerful div with lots of layout functionality.

content_direction_lg.description:
This dictates the direction of your content. 
Row = Left to Right
Column = Top to Bottom

justify_content_lg.description: Control how the items in this section are positioned along the section's main axis.

align_items_lg.description:
This defines how your content aligns across the secondary axis. If you have 2 items inside this container, and your content direction is a "row", this can choose whether both are aligned to the top, bottom, stretching across the entire container, etc. 
Experiment and see how it works.

wrap_content_lg.description: This allows the direct-child elements to wrap themselves around the column/row.

gap_lg.description:
This is the gap between the elements (bloks) within this section. So the amount of space between 'items' you add. 

-1  === no value
0 === overwrites any previous gap values and sets it to 0
1-20 === gaps with sizes.

flex_lg.description:
This is a flex-child property. You can set the 
Flex Grow + Flex Shrink + Flex Basis with this single property.
Default     =  1 1 0%
Flex Auto  = 1 1 auto
Flex Initial = 0 1 auto
Flex None = none

align_self_lg.description: Override for the flex parent's align-items value. We can align the flex-child-item on the cross-axis.

margin_top_lg.description:
This pushes other content away on top of this container.

-1  === no value
0 === overwrites any previous margin values and sets it to 0
1-20 === margins with sizes.

margin_bottom_lg.description:
This pushes other content away on the bottom of this container.

-1  === no value
0 === overwrites any previous margin values and sets it to 0
1-20 === margins with sizes.

all_padding_lg.description:
Padding is the space within the container that pushes the content inwards. If you have a background for example, you will see space within the container that surrounds your content.

-1  === no value
0 === overwrites any previous padding values and sets it to 0
1-20 === paddings with sizes.

horizontal_padding_lg.description:
Horizontal Padding controls the "empty space" on the left and right parts of a section. 
Default: -1

-1  === no value
0 === overwrites any previous margin values and sets it to 0
1-20 === margins with sizes.

vertical_padding_lg.description:
Vertical Padding controls the "empty space" on the top and bottom parts of this container. 
Default: -1

-1  === no value
0 === overwrites any previous margin values and sets it to 0
1-20 === margins with sizes.

options.value: Simple way to manipulate the width of our element based on its content or based on its parent's height.
options.name: unset

width_lg.description: Simple way to manipulate the width of our element based on its content or based on its parent's height.

max_width_lg.description:
Choose the maximum width of this container. 
0 = No Max Width + Width Full
1-19 = Various sizes based on Tailwind's system
20 = Max width is 'max-content'

height_lg.description: Simple way to manipulate the height of our element based on its content or based on its parent's height.

text_align_lg.description: Select how you wish to align font for text this container will hold.

blocks.description: Fill this with the content you wish to populate the container with.

storyblok_name.description: This is how you will be able to recognise what this container "contains" when looking in the visual editor. So just 1-2 descriptive words to help you understand that this container represents.

container_id.description:
The id by which this container can be referenced to in code.
If one word, simply input the name in lower caps.
If multiple words follow the kebab-format like so:
section-id-like-this

container_class.description: Same as id, this can be used for DOM manipulation or other means.

custom_css.description: You can add custom CSS styling here. Ensure it's written as in-line css and every css property/value you add comes with an " !important " value as well.

overflow.description:
Select what happens when content overflows this section. In most cases the default option will be preferable.
Default: Visible

background_color.description: Select the background color of the container.

border_radius.description: Border radius controls how sharp or curved the edges of the link are.

border_color.description: Please select what border color you wish to have.

border_thickness.description: Select how thick your border is.

content_direction_md.description:
This dictates the direction of your content. 
Row = Left to Right
Column = Top to Bottom

justify_content_md.description: Control how the items in this section are positioned along the section's main axis.

align_items_md.description:

Experiment and see how it works.

0 === overwrites any previous gap values and sets it to 0
1-20 === gaps with sizes.

Flex None = none

0 === overwrites any previous margin values and sets it to 0
1-20 === margins with sizes.

margin_bottom_md.description:
This pushes other content away on the bottom of this container.

-1  === no value
0 === overwrites any previous margin values and sets it to 0
1-20 === margins with sizes.

1-19 = Various sizes based on Tailwind's system
20 = Max width is 'max-content'

height_md.description: Simple way to manipulate the height of our element based on its content or based on its parent's height.

text_align_md.description: Select how you wish to align font for text this container will hold.

Column = Top to Bottom

horizontal_padding_default.description:
Horizontal Padding controls the "empty space" on the left and right parts of a section. 
Default: 2

vertical_padding_default.description:
Vertical Padding controls the "empty space" in the top and bottom parts of a section. 
Default: 6

width_default.description: Simple way to manipulate the width of our element based on its content or based on its parent's height.

max_width_default.description:
Choose the maximum width of this container. 
0 = No Max Width + Width Full
1-19 = Various sizes based on Tailwind's system
20 = Max width is 'max-content'

min_width_default.description: You may require a minimum width of an element. Make sure to also select the 'minWidthUnit' option.

min_width_unit_default.description: This allows us to have more control over the minWidth, by being able to select units like 'vw', 'px' or 'rem' units, we can manipulate the container freely.

height_default.description: Simple way to manipulate the height of our element based on its content or based on its parent's height.

min_height_default.description: You may require a minimum height of an element. Make sure to also select the 'minHeightUnit' option.

min_height_unit_default.description: This allows us to have more control over the minHeight, by being able to select units like 'vh', 'px' or 'rem' units, we can manipulate the container freely.

text_align_default.description: Select how you wish to align font for text this container will hold.

If one word, simply input the name in lower caps.
If multiple words follow the kebab-format like so:
section-id-like-this

content_direction.description:
This dictates the direction of your content. 
Row = Left to Right, Single column on mobile.
Only Row = Left to Right
Column = Top to Bottom

justify_content.description: Control how the items in this section are positioned along the section's main axis.

This defines how your content aligns across the secondary axis. If you have 2 items inside this container, and your content direction is a "row", this can choose whether both are aligned to the top, bottom, stretching across the entire container, etc.

0 = No Max Width + Width Full
1-19 = Various sizes based on Tailwind's system
20 = Max width is 'max-content'

height.description: Simple way to manipulate the height of our element based on its content or based on its parent's height.

Vertical Padding controls the "empty space" in the top and bottom parts of a section. 
Default: 6

horizontal_padding.description:
Horizontal Padding controls the "empty space" on the left and right parts of a section. 
Default: 2

min_height.description: You may require a minimum height of an element. Make sure to also select the 'minHeightUnit' option.

min_height_unit.description: This allows us to have more control over the minHeight, by being able to select units like 'vh', 'px' or 'rem' units, we can manipulate the container freely.

min_width_unit.description: This allows us to have more control over the minWidth, by being able to select units like 'vw', 'px' or 'rem' units, we can manipulate the container freely.

customStyling.description: You can add custom CSS styling here. Ensure it's written as in-line css and every css property/value you add comes with an " !important " value as well.

overflow.description:
Select what happens when content overflows this section. In most cases the default option will be preferable.
Default: Visible

background_color.description: Select the background color of the container.

border_radius.description: Border radius controls how sharp or curved the edges of the link are.

border_color.description: Please select what border color you wish to have.

border_thickness.description: Select how thick your border is.

hero_section_style.description: This determines the style of the hero section. Please refer back to the CTS System in Figma if you're unsure of which section is which.

section.description: Simply input the core ID, label and those sort of properties. The rest can be ignored as we will not be using the section component, just some data from the blok.

hero_heading.description: Please select the Text component and create your heading with its preferred styling.

hero_image.description: Select the Image component and provide your preferred image. It will be best if it's not styled too much as that may impact the hero section in unplanned ways.

hero_description.description: Please provide the description. This will often be "how I can get you what I promised in my heading". So briefly explain how you deliver the result you wish to deliver.

hero_cta.description: Select any buttons if you need them as CTAs (calls to action) for the hero section. It's advisable to use at least 1 CTA and a maximum of 2.

heading_styles.description: Select whether you want Serif or Sans Serif for your headings.

divider_color.description: Select the color of the divider. Basic primary surface 100 by default.

divider_max_width.description:
Choose the maximum width of this container. 
0 = No Max Width + Width Full
1-19 = Various sizes based on Tailwind's system
20 = Max width is 'max-content'

display.description:
Select whether you want inline or block styling for this text.
blok = always goes on a new line
inline = stays inline with the other existing content.

footer_cta_bloks.description: If you require your footer to have a cta you can add one here.

column_label.description: Select the text that will be on the top of this column of links.

form_inputs.description: Select the form inputs you need.

form_action.description: This has to match the server code.

zod_base_type.description: This is the zod-specific type. Zod has very few primitive types and almost everything we need is in 'string'.

input_type.description: This is the field type. This should be used with common sense, but if nothing seems obvious, just ask Rafal to explain it.

input_autocomplete.description: Optional field to allow the browser to communicate what automatic input this field can have.

input_name.description:
This is the name of this input field. Use it to clarify what it is for, in lowercaps.
E.g.: "name", "email", "message", etc.

input_label.description: This is what is shown to the user. "Name", "Email", "Message" etc.

input_placeholder.description: The placeholder is text that will be automatically shown to the user before they type anything. It has a 'greyed out' appearance. However, it is advised that you leave this empty as the form design will not be helped by this very much.

validation_rules.description: Select the types of validation you want this field to contain.

required_error.description: If this field is required it is best to set a message for it. So when someone tries submitting the form and leaves this field empty, it will show them a message.

invalid_type_error.description: If this field is strictly 'something', like text, you can clarify that someone is submitting the wrong format with a message.

custom_label_css.description:
You can write some inline CSS for the label component.
Our HTML structure is:
Label
      Span (Label)
      Input
      Span (Error/s)

custom_label_span_css.description:
You can write some inline CSS for the label-text component.
Our HTML structure is:
Label
      Span (Label) <--- This one
      Input
      Span (Error/s)

custom_input_css.description:
You can write some inline CSS for the Input component.
Our HTML structure is:
Label
      Span (Label)
      Input <--- this one
      Span (Error/s)

custom_error_span_css.description:
You can write some inline CSS for the Errors-Span component.
Our HTML structure is:
Label
      Span (Label)
      Input
      Span (Error/s) <---- This one

validation_rule_type.description: Select what kind of validation rule this is.

validation_rule_value.description:
Select the value the validation should have.
Examples: 5, /*/, 1, tuna.
Not all fields require a value. Email for example does not. But things like min/max/regex do.

validation_rule_message.description:
If the validation rule condition is not met, you can give a specific message to the user:

"Needs to be at least 5 chars", "Needs to be no longer than 10 letters", "Can't have numbers" etc.

zod_base_type.description: This is the zod-specific type. Zod has very few primitive types and almost everything we need is in 'string'.

input_name.description:
This is the name of this input field. Use it to clarify what it is for, in lowercaps.
E.g.: "name", "email", "message", etc.

textarea_label.description: This is what is shown to the user. "Name", "Email", "Message" etc.

textarea_placeholder.description: The placeholder is text that will be automatically shown to the user before they type anything. It has a 'greyed out' appearance. However, it is advised that you leave this empty as the form design will not be helped by this very much.

validation_rules.description: Select the types of validation you want this field to contain.

      Span (Error/s)

custom_error_span_css.description:
You can write some inline CSS for the Errors-Span component.
Our HTML structure is:
Label
      Span (Label)
      Input
      Span (Error/s) <---- This one

fixed_to_top.description:
Toggle this on if you want the navigation to always be visible on the top of your website. Else, leave it off and the user can scroll back up to access navigation.

Both behaviours are quite normal is it's a matter of personal preference.

logo.description: Please create the logo for your website. You will have a single element as a choice, click on it and fill it in.

nav_links.description:
These are the links your users will see on the top of your website.

This does NOT include the logo or Call to Action button in the top-navigation, just the centre links.

button.description: This is an optional button you can add to act as a CTA in your top/header navigation. It goes on the right of the navigation.

custom_css.description: Optional custom css you can add to the <div> containing the svg icon.

icon_fill.description: Fill your icon with color. Will overwrite any other styling already applied.

icon_stroke.description: Give your icon with a stroke color. Will overwrite any other styling already applied.

figcaption.description: You can add a figcaption to the bottom of your image if you want to provide additional context for it.

custom_decoration.description: Add custom decoration around the image with ::before & ::after pseudo elements.

decorative_image.description: If this image does not add any context to the surrounding text, toggle this "on" / "true". Then screen readers will be able to ignore this image and won't even mention it to anyone with visual impairments.

aspect_ratio.description:
Force an aspect ratio on your image.
Tips: 
Landscape = 16:9
Vertical = 9:16
Square = 1:1

max_width.description: Decide whether you need the image to have a maximum width.

max_height.description: Decide whether you need the image to have a maximum height.

min_height.description: Select a minimum height of your image. Also remember to select the unit, else it will default to pixels (px).

min_height_unit.description: If you have selected a 'min_height', please select what unit corresponds with it.

object_position.description: Sometimes the container the image in is smaller than the image itself, and the effect is that the image is 'cut-off' at a certain point. With this option you can choose how to best position the image. If you need a more custom size, please use 'focal_point'.

mix_blendmode.description: Choose how this image should blend with the background.

border_radius.description: Border radius controls how sharp or curved the edges of the link are.

image_quality.description: This determines the quality of the images that are downloaded by controlling the requested-resolution from Storyblok's image service. If you need a small image, test the smaller sizes. If you need more sizes added, please request them.

base_width.description: This is the mobile image width that is downloaded. The default is set to 500px, it will look presentable until the next breakpoint.

sepia_filter.description: Add a sepia filter to your image. Sepia is essentially a warm color overtone over your image.

invert_filter.description: Invert the colors of this image.

contrast_filter.description: Increase the contrast of your image.

components.name: nav_link
components.description: This link should only be used in the Header component, not Footer.

url.description:
This is where clicking the logo takes you. 
1. Select "URL".
2. Just type "/" without the quotation marks if you want to go to the homepage.

Else just type "/about" or "/services" etc.

link_label.description:
This is what the website user reads. 

So this should be "Home" | "About" | "Services" | "Work with Me" | "Contact" etc (without the quotation marks).

icon.description: Select this option and then an icon if you want an icon to accompany your link.

link_description.description: Add a description to the link to explain what it does and where it will take you.

sub_links.description: If you want a 'menu' of links, lets say you have multiple services and you want users to hover over services and see options, this is the link you should use.

sub_link_type.description:
If this is not a sub_link (embedded link), ignore.
Else, if it is a sub_link, you have the option to style the link slightly differently.

If you have 3 services, you can have 3 sub links for them. But you also might want to have a "All Services" link that's clickable. In that case this would be a "mobileMainLink". In mobile the sub_link menus are opened by clicking on buttons, not links. This is just a workaround that's very explicit.

components.name: nav_logo
components.description: Use this logo only for the Header component.

url.description:
This is where clicking the logo takes you. 
1. Select "URL".
2. Just type "/" without the quotation marks if you want to go to the homepage.

Else just type "/about" or "/services" etc.

logo_image.description: In some cases you will want your logo to just be an image (PNG, SVG, etc). Simply upload an image and select it here.

logo_text.description: Select and input the text you wish to be displayed.

gap.description: Choose the amount of space between the logo image and the text (if both are present). Else this property won't do anything.

components.name: page
components.description: All page content, excluding header and footer.

blocks.description: Insert the website content into this blok .This excludes the Header and Footer elements. Do not expose any private data into this component as everything you input will be exposed to the public, so only public content goes in here.

mainAriaLabel.description:
Describe what this page's content is all about.
For example, if this is the 'About Page', you can say:
"Main content that explains who <First_Name/Company_Name> is all about."

pagePosition.description: This controls the position property for CSS. It's advisable to just leave this setting alone and let your developer handle it if needed.

card_title.description:
This is the heading-text of your price card. It will usually be used for telling your customer, in summary, what they are buying.
"Single Coaching Session"
"Premium Package"
"Free To Feel"
etc.

card_recommended_option.description:
Turn this toggle on if this is a recommended package. Only use this once in a single list of cards. It loses its' impact if used multiple times.

It has no functional difference, it simply stands out more.

card_price.description:
Enter the price of this item.
If you enter 0 (ZERO), it will be displayed as "FREE".

card_price_helper_text.description:
Optional field to give your price a little bit more context. For example, if the service you're selling is currently on sale or if the package someone is looking at saves them money, you can say "Save 10%".
This field will be displayed as a small helper text next to the price.

card_description.description: Small paragraph to fully explain what someone is buying/getting by selecting this 'package'.

card_info_points.description:
Simply enter the list of 'selling points' of this package/service. 
If the duration is 60 minutes, if someone is getting 3 sessions, if they get free perks:
"3 x 60min"
"Free resources"
"Cool stuff"

price_id.description:
This is the price_id of the service/package you are selling. This is required and you can find it within stripe. 
If unsure, please contact Rafal.

label.description:
This is what the user reads on the button that you want them to click on.
"Buy Single Session" or "Buy Package" or "Buy 6 Sessions" etc.

url.description:
This is the internal (or external) link you are sending the user to for this service/package.

If you are using stripe, please use the other component called "Price Card Stripe Btn".

label.description:
This is what the user reads on the button that you want them to click on.
"Buy Single Session" or "Buy Package" or "Buy 6 Sessions" etc.

section_id.description:
The id by which this section can be referenced to in code.
If one word, simply input the name in lower caps.
If multiple words follow the kebab-format like so:
section-id-like-this

section_labelledby.description: A short sentence-long description of what this section is about. If the section is the 'benefits' section it could be: "A list of benefits my service offers you."

type.description:
Choose whether this is a section or an article. This does not mean a 'newsletter article' or anything like that, it's a semantic HTML element that symbolises this 'section' is a standalone piece of content, as in ~ it makes sense by itself, with no other content around it. 

Most of the time this should be left as the default 'section' option.

grid_span.description: Full Span = Full Width. Centred Spans = Limited Widths

justify_content.description: Control how the items in this section are positioned along the section's main axis.

align_items.description: Control how your items are positioned along a container's cross axis.

gap.description: This is the gap between the elements (bloks) within this section. So the amount of space between 'items' you add.

vertical_padding.description:
Vertical Padding controls the "empty space" in the top and bottom parts of a section. 
Default: 6

horizontal_padding.description:
Horizontal Padding controls the "empty space" on the left and right parts of a section. 
Default: 2

overflow.description:
Select what happens when content overflows this section. In most cases the default option will be preferable.
Default: Visible

customStyling.description: You can add custom CSS styling here. Ensure it's written as in-line css and every css property/value you add comes with an " !important " value as well.

components.name: simple_card
components.description: Use this to display basic pieces of text.

text_content.description: Use this to populate the container with the required text.

flex.description:
This is a flex-child property. You can set the 
Flex Grow + Flex Shrink + Flex Basis with this single property.
Default     =  1 1 0%
Flex Auto  = 1 1 auto
Flex Initial = 0 1 auto
Flex None = none

align_self.description: Override for the flex parent's align-items value. We can align the flex-child-item on the cross-axis.

background_color.description: Select the background color of the container.

border_radius.description: Border radius controls how sharp or curved the edges of the link are.

max_width.description:
Choose the maximum width of this container. 
0 = No Max Width + Width Full
1-19 = Various sizes based on Tailwind's system
20 = Max width is 'max-content'

gap.description: This is the gap between the elements (bloks) within this section. So the amount of space between 'items' you add.

all_padding.description: Padding is the space within the container that pushes the content inwards. If you have a background for example, you will see space within the container that surrounds your content.

vertical_padding.description:
Vertical Padding controls the "empty space" in the top and bottom parts of a section. 
Default: 6

horizontal_padding.description:
Horizontal Padding controls the "empty space" on the left and right parts of a section. 
Default: 2

components.name: simple_text
components.description: Text with no styling attached to it. Simple string.

components.name: svg_divider
components.description: Use this to divide containers, sections and more with SVGs we can easily add.

fill_color.description: Select the fill color you want for your svg. If something is not working as expected, please try selecting the stroke color.

stroke_color.description: Select the stroke color you want for your svg. If something is not working as expected, please try selecting the fill color.

flip_horizontally.description: If you need to flip the SVG horizontally, toggle this on.

width.description: Select the width of your SVG. If you want to use height instead, switch this to 0 and go to height to select the one you want.

height.description: Select the height of your SVG. If you want to use width instead, switch this to 0 and go to width to select the one you want.

y_translate_value.description: Select how much you want to translate this unit vertically.

y_translate_unit.description: Select the unit for how much you want to translate this unit vertically.

x_translate_value.description: Select how much you want to translate this unit horizontally.

x_translate_unit.description: Select the unit for how much you want to translate this unit horizontally.

top_absolute_value.description: Select how far away from the top of the div you want to be.

top_absolute_unit.description: Select the unit for how far away from the top of the div you want to be.

right_absolute_value.description: Select how far away from the right of the div you want to be.

right_absolute_unit.description: Select the unit for how far away from the right of the div you want to be.

bottom_absolute_value.description: Select how far away from the bottom of the div you want to be.

bottom_absolute_unit.description: Select the unit for how far away from the bottom of the div you want to be.

left_absolute_value.description: Select how far away from the left of the div you want to be.

left_absolute_unit.description: Select the unit for how far away from the left of the div you want to be.

testimonial_title.description: Give this testimonial a snappy and descriptive title. This will be the 'key' pro of working with you.

testimonial_summary.description: This is the first 3-4 lines of the testimonial.

testimonial_name.description: This is the name and title of the person submitting the testimonial to you.

testimonial_button_text.description:
This is the text that is shown on the bottom right of the testimonial to signal to the user that the testimonial can be clicked on so someone can read everything. 
By default it's set to "Click to read more"

content.description: Simply write what you want to be shown or read by a screen-reader. (There is an option to select "Screen Reader" which means this won't be shown to people who can see the website, but it will be read to individuals using screen readers.)

storyblok_name.description: Use this to give yourself context as to what this text field is for within storyblok. This property does not touch the code side.

text_id.description:
This is useful to fill when this is the heading for a section.
Sections use the {aria-labelledby} html property. We can essentially write:
aria-labelledby="about-section-heading"

And this id can equal that. A blind person will find this to be a great piece of information.

text_type.description: Select what element this is. If it's a heading, select Heading {heading_number}. Paragraph for paragraphs, etc...

text_style.description: Our design system gives specific colors, fonts and styles to everything. Choose wisely...

text_align.description: Choose how to align your text (center, left, right, etc).

max_width.description:
You can select a maximum width for this text.
Be mindful it will impact all screen sizes.

font_weight_set.description: If this font is not a variable font, please use this option to set a custom weight on the font. Otherwise, you can use Font Weight Variable (next setting) to set a more precise font weight for variable fonts.

font_weight_variable.description: If this font is a variable font to set a precise font weight for variable fonts. Otherwise, if this option has no results beyond setting divisibles of 100 (100,200,...), then the font is likely not a variable font and you need to use Font Weight Set (previous option to this one).

custom_css.description:
Optional custom CSS field for inline CSS.
Keep in mind you can add media queries this way.

rich_text.description:
You have the option of using this rich text. Be mindful it will overwrite any other text you have in the text_content. 

If you experience any bugs with this please contact Rafal.

multi_line_bloks.description:
If you desire specific line-breaks for your text, usually in the hero section of a website, please add some embed_text components into here. Also make sure to select 
Mode = Multi Line

mode.description: If you wish to have text broken down by line, please select "multi line" here and add some embed_text components into the Multi Line Bloks options.
